description: Long ago there was a little land, over which ruled a regulus or kinglet, who was called King Peter, though his kingdom was but little. He had four sons whose names were Blaise, Hugh, Gregory and Ralph: of these Ralph was the youngest, whereas he was but of twenty winters and one; and Blaise was the oldest and had seen thirty winters.
title: The Well at the World's End

first_sentence.value: Long ago there was a little land, over which ruled a regulus or kinglet, who was called King Peter, though his kingdom was but little.
